title: Green ankle-length cheongsam with silver thread
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00140

  Image: 

  object_work_type: folk costume

  title_text: Green ankle-length cheongsam with silver thread

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: 1960 - 1969

  creation_place_original_location: Singapore

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Chinese (culture or style)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: cloth

  techniques_name: machine sewing (technique)

  object_colour: multicoloured

  physical_appearance: This is an ankle-length cheongsam that is long-sleeved. There is a collar present as well. There are no visible tears on the exterior of the cheongsam. The cheongsam is green and there are green and brown floral and leaf motifs appearing all over the cheongsam. The piping of the cheongsam runs from the collar to its left side
 just below the point where its left sleeve begins. There are six silver coloured buttons along the piping. There is a slit present on the right side of the cheongsam.

  subject_terms_1: dresses (garments) womenswear plant-derived motifs floral patterns allover patterns

  subject_terms_2: Women\u0027s clothing Motifs Qipao Ethnic costume

  subject_terms_3: Ethnic costume Chinese costume

  sgcool_label_text: This is an ankle-length green cheongsam with long sleeves that has brown and green floral and leaf motifs with silver thread. The print motifs are similar to prints found on fabric from India. The sleeves of the cheongsam are tapered at the ends and could be secured by snap buttons
 to emphasise the slender arms of the wearer.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is an ankle-length green cheongsam with long sleeves that has brown and green floral and leaf motifs with silver thread. The print motifs are similar to prints found on fabric from India. The sleeves of the cheongsam are tapered at the ends and could be secured by snap buttons, to emphasise the slender arms of the wearer.
